title: Zygaena trifolii
text:
Zygaena trifolii, the five-spot burnet, is a <a href="moth">moth</a> in the family <a href="Zygaenidae">Zygaenidae</a>. It is found from <a href="North%20Africa">North Africa</a>, through the western <a href="Mediterranean">Mediterranean</a>, <a href="Great%20Britain">Great Britain</a> and central Europe to <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>. It is not found in <a href="Scandinavia">Scandinavia</a>.
The <a href="wingspan">wingspan</a> is 28–33 mm. Adults are on wing from the mid-June to the beginning of August in one generation per year.
The larvae feed on the leaves of "<a href="Lotus%20uliginosus">Lotus uliginosus</a>" and "<a href="Lotus%20corniculatus">Lotus corniculatus</a>". The species overwinters in the larval stage and may overwinter twice.
